description.narrative:

TBD-HQ will work in partnership with USG CAR to provide peer-to-peer technical assistance to build capacity of MOH HIV surveillance staff in Belize, Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras and Panama to address the following objectives: 1) conduct quality improvement of national HIV case-based surveillance systems, and 2) increase HIV data use activities to inform prevention, care and treatment programs. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. objectives

TBD-HQ will work in partnership with USG CAR to provide peer-to-peer technical assistance to build capacity of MOH HIV surveillance staff in Belize, Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras and Panama to address the following objectives: 1) conduct quality improvement of national HIV case-based surveillance systems, and 2) increase HIV data use activities to inform prevention, care and treatment programs. TBD-HQ will also provide technical assistance to support HIV mortality surveillance capacity building of MOH HIV surveillance staff in Guatemala. These efforts will improve the quality of HIV data collection, analysis, and use of programmatic and strategic information to allow monitoring of HIV and AIDS programs and understanding of trends and contributing behaviors, especially behaviors of KPs. This mechanism will strive to provide technical assistance remotely vs. in country, whenever possible, using existing/modified materials vs. newly developed materials as a cost-efficient strategy. All trained MOH surveillance staff will be government staff who will be provided with specific training to replicate HIV surveillance trainings for other MOH staff as needed. By strengthening institutional capacity of MOH, TBD-HQ will be able to increase cost efficiency of implementing these activities over time. TBD-HQ will develop a work plan for each country describing the task to be completed, the person responsible for each task, and the timeline for task completion to ensure successful and timely implementation of these activities. All activities will be monitored monthly by TBD-HQ using specific process and output indicators that will be identified at a later time.
